1.brief: to fasten upon; hence, to seize, be strong (figuratively, courageous, causatively strengthen, cure, help, repair, fortify), obstinate; to bind, restrain, conquer
seven (as the sacred full one); also (adverbially) seven times; by implication, a week; by extension, an indefinite number
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
properly, united, i.e. one; or (as an ordinal) first
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)
properly, wrap around, i.e. (by implication) to put on agarment or clothe (oneself, or another), literally or figuratively
properly, leanness, i.e. (figuratively) limitation; only adverbial, merely, or conjunctional, although
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to gather for any purpose; hence, to receive, take away, i.e. remove (destroy, leave behind, put up, restore, etc.)

2.brief: a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a sprout (usually concrete), literal or figurative
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
splendor (as conspicuous); also a gazelle (as beautiful)
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
ornament (abstractly or concretely, literally or figuratively)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

3.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, to swell up, i.e. be (causatively, make) redundant
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
to jut over or exceed; by implication, to excel; (intransitively) to remain or be left; causatively, to leave, cause to abound, preserve
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
sacred (ceremonially or morally); (as noun) God (by eminence), an angel, a saint, a sanctuary
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to grave, by implication, to write (describe, inscribe, prescribe, subscribe)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine

4.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to lave (the whole or a part of a thing)
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
to thrust away; figuratively, to cleanse
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
to kindle, i.e. consume (by fire or by eating);  to be(-come) brutish

5.brief: (absolutely) to create; (qualified) to cut down (a wood), select, feed (as formative processes)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, a fixture, i.e. a basis; generally a place, especially as an abode
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
something called out, i.e. a public meeting (the act, the persons, or the place); also a rehearsal
a cloud (as covering the sky), i.e. the nimbus or thunder-cloud
daily
smoke, literally or figuratively (vapor, dust, anger)
brilliancy (literally or figuratively)
fire (literally or figuratively)
{a flash; figuratively, a sharply polished blade or point of aweapon}
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
a canopy
